title: Authors and Citation
text: Javier Ramos. Author, maintainer. Victor Ballesteros. Contributor. Catalina Quijada. Contributor. Gabriel Molina. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ramos J (2026). minioR: Simplified Robust Interface MinIO Object Storage. R package version 0.1.0, https://inesscc.github.io/minioR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {minioR: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage},   author = {Javier Ramos},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://inesscc.github.io/minioR/}, }

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
text: minioR R package provides simple, consistent, production-ready interface interacting MinIO object storage R. package acts lightweight wrapper around low-level S3-compatible APIs, focusing : Clear explicit function naming Robust error handling Safe defaults data workflows Ease use analytical data engineering pipelines minioR especially suited data teams using MinIO data lake, object store, intermediate storage layer.

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
text: Upload download objects /MinIO Support -memory (raw) file-based uploads Explicit handling content types Multipart upload support large objects Clear informative error messages Minimal configuration sensible defaults

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
text: released CRAN, install package :
code: install.packages("minioR")

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
text: can install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("https://github.com/inesscc/minioR.git")

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
text: minioR uses standard MinIO / S3 environment variables. Make sure following variables defined using package: HTTPS can enabled depending MinIO deployment.
code: Sys.setenv(   AWS_S3_ENDPOINT = "localhost:9000",   AWS_REGION = "us-east-1",   AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY = "minioadmin",   AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID = "minioadmin",   AWS_SIGNATURE_VERSION=2 )

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
code: objs <- minio_list_objects(   bucket = "data",   prefix = "raw/",   recursive = TRUE )

what: Read a CSV directly from MinIO
title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
code: df <- minio_get_csv(   bucket = "data",   object = "raw/example.csv" )

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
code: minio_put_object(   bucket = "data",   object = "tmp/hello.txt",   raw_obj = charToRaw("Hello MinIO"),   content_type = "text/plain" )

title: Simplified and Robust Interface for MinIO Object Storage
text: Full documentation, tutorials, function reference available package website: https://inesscc.github.io/minioR/ site built pkgdown includes: Getting started guides Format-specific readers writers Data lake patterns best practices Complete function reference

what: minioR: A Simple MinIO Client for R — minioR
title: minioR: A Simple MinIO Client for R — minioR
text: `minioR` provides set functions interact Amazon S3–compatible object storage services MinIO. allows uploading, downloading, copying, listing, deleting objects directly R.

title: minioR: A Simple MinIO Client for R — minioR
text: package designed data engineering workflows, automation, testing scenarios, offering simple explicit interface.

title: minioR: A Simple MinIO Client for R — minioR
text: Access MinIO configured using environment variables: AWS_S3_ENDPOINT Endpoint URL (e.g. localhost:9000) AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY Access key AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID Secret key AWS_SIGNATURE_VERSION Use value = 2 AWS_REGION Region (optional)

title: minioR: A Simple MinIO Client for R — minioR
text: Configure environment variables Upload objects using minio_put_object() Download objects using minio_download_object()

title: minioR: A Simple MinIO Client for R — minioR
text: Maintainer: Javier Ramos jaramosg@ine.gob.cl contributors: Victor Ballesteros vaballesteros@ine.gob.cl [contributor] Catalina Quijada caquijada@ine.gob.cl [contributor] Gabriel Molina gemolinah@ine.gob.cl [contributor]

what: Copy an Object in MinIO — minio_copy_object
title: Copy an Object in MinIO — minio_copy_object
text: Copies object source bucket/key destination bucket/key using S3 CopyObject operation (supported MinIO). function first checks source object exists using minio_object_exists.

title: Copy an Object in MinIO — minio_copy_object
code: minio_copy_object(   from_bucket,   from_object,   to_bucket,   to_object = NULL,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Copy an Object in MinIO — minio_copy_object
text: from_bucket Character. Source bucket name. from_object Character. Source object key (path). to_bucket Character. Destination bucket name. to_object Character NULL. Destination object key (path). NULL empty, defaults from_object. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Copy an Object in MinIO — minio_copy_object
text: Invisibly returns TRUE copy successful.

title: Copy an Object in MinIO — minio_copy_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Copy within the same bucket minio_copy_object(   from_bucket = "assets",   from_object = "data/file.csv",   to_bucket = "assets",   to_object = "archive/file.csv" )  # Copy to another bucket (same key) minio_copy_object(   from_bucket = "raw",   from_object = "data/file.parquet",   to_bucket = "curated" ) } # }

what: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
title: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
text: Downloads object stored MinIO bucket saves local file. downloading, function checks whether object exists using minio_object_exists. object exist, error raised.

title: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
code: minio_download_object(bucket, object, destfile, use_https = TRUE, region = "")

title: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. destfile Character. Local file path downloaded object saved. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
text: Invisibly returns destfile.

title: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
text: download streamed directly disk (.e., full object loaded memory).

title: Download an Object from MinIO to Disk — minio_download_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ minio_download_object(   bucket = "assets",   object = "path/file.parquet",   destfile = "path/file.parquet" ) } # }

what: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
title: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
text: Uploads local directory MinIO bucket preserving relative folder structure, similar "sync". Files discovered dir uploaded using minio_fput_object.

title: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
code: minio_fput_dir(   bucket,   dir,   prefix = NULL,   recursive = TRUE,   include = NULL,   exclude = NULL,   dry_run = FALSE,   multipart = FALSE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. dir Character. Local directory path upload. prefix Character NULL. Optional object key prefix inside bucket. provided, objects uploaded prefix. Example: "raw/projectA". recursive Logical. Whether include subdirectories. Defaults TRUE. include Character vector regex patterns. provided, files whose relative path matches least one pattern included. exclude Character vector regex patterns. provided, files whose relative path matches pattern excluded. dry_run Logical. TRUE, upload anything; return planned uploads. Defaults FALSE. multipart Logical. Whether enable multipart upload. Defaults FALSE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
text: data.frame upload plan results. Columns:   local_file, object, uploaded, error.   dry_run = TRUE, uploaded FALSE error NA.

title: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
text: can filter files upload using include exclude regex patterns applied relative path (POSIX style, forward slashes).

title: Upload a Local Directory to MinIO (Preserve Structure) — minio_fput_dir
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Upload entire directory under a prefix res <- minio_fput_dir(   bucket = "assets",   dir = "data/projectA",   prefix = "raw/projectA",   recursive = TRUE,   exclude = c("\\\\.tmp$", "^\\.git/", "\\\\.DS_Store$"),   dry_run = FALSE ) } # }

what: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
title: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
text: Uploads local file MinIO bucket. object name provided, base name local file path used object key.

title: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
code: minio_fput_object(   bucket,   object = NULL,   file,   multipart = FALSE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character NULL. Object key (path) use bucket. NULL empty, defaults basename(file). file Character. Path local file upload. multipart Logical. Whether enable multipart upload. Defaults FALSE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
text: Logical. Returns TRUE upload successful.

title: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
text: function wraps put_object adds input validation clearer error handling MinIO environments.

title: Upload a Local File to MinIO — minio_fput_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ minio_fput_object(   bucket = "assets",   object = "raw/example.parquet",   file = "data/example.parquet" ) } # }

what: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
title: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
text: Downloads CSV object stored MinIO bucket reads memory data.frame. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object delegates parsing read.csv.

title: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
code: minio_get_csv(bucket, object, ...)

title: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) CSV file within bucket. ... Additional arguments passed read.csv(), sep, header, stringsAsFactors, fileEncoding, etc.

title: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
text: data.frame containing contents CSV file.

title: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
text: Additional arguments passed directly read.csv(), allowing control separators, headers, encoding, parsing options.

title: Read a CSV File from MinIO — minio_get_csv
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- minio_get_csv(   bucket = "assets",   object = "path/file.csv",   sep = ";",   header = TRUE,   fileEncoding = "latin1" ) } # }

what: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
title: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
text: Downloads Stata .dta file stored MinIO bucket reads memory base data.frame. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, writes temporary file, delegates parsing read_dta.

title: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
code: minio_get_dta(bucket, object, ...)

title: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) .dta file within bucket. ... Additional arguments passed haven::read_dta().

title: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
text: base data.frame containing contents Stata file.

title: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
text: Additional arguments forwarded haven::read_dta(), allowing control encoding, labelled values, user-defined missing values, Stata-specific parsing options. Regardless return type produced haven::read_dta() (example, tibble), result always coerced base data.frame consistency minio_get_* readers.

title: Read a Stata (.dta) File from MinIO — minio_get_dta
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- minio_get_dta(   bucket = "assets",   object = "survey/data_2023.dta" ) } # }

what: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
title: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
text: Downloads Excel .xlsx file stored MinIO bucket reads memory base data.frame. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, writes temporary file (required readxl), delegates parsing read_xlsx.

title: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
code: minio_get_excel(bucket, object, ...)

title: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) Excel file within bucket. ... Additional arguments passed readxl::read_xlsx().

title: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
text: base data.frame containing contents Excel file.

title: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
text: Additional arguments forwarded readxl::read_xlsx(), allowing control sheets, ranges, column types, column names, Excel-specific parsing options. Regardless return type produced readxl::read_xlsx() (example, tibble), result always coerced base data.frame consistency minio_get_* readers.

title: Read an Excel (.xlsx) File from MinIO — minio_get_excel
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- minio_get_excel(   bucket = "assets",   object = "reports/sales_2024.xlsx",   sheet = 1 ) } # }

what: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
title: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
text: Downloads Feather .feather file stored MinIO bucket reads memory base data.frame. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, writes temporary file, delegates parsing read_feather.

title: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
code: minio_get_feather(bucket, object, ...)

title: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) Feather file within bucket. ... Additional arguments passed feather::read_feather().

title: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
text: base data.frame containing contents Feather file.

title: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
text: Additional arguments forwarded feather::read_feather(), allowing control column selection, memory mapping, Feather-specific reading options. Regardless return type produced feather::read_feather(), result always coerced base data.frame consistency minio_get_* reader functions.

title: Read a Feather File from MinIO — minio_get_feather
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- minio_get_feather(   bucket = "assets",   object = "analytics/features.feather" ) } # }

what: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
title: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
text: Downloads JSON file stored MinIO bucket parses R. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, converts text, delegates parsing fromJSON.

title: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
code: minio_get_json(bucket, object, ...)

title: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) JSON file within bucket. ... Additional arguments passed jsonlite::fromJSON().

title: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
text: R object representing parsed JSON content (often list   vector; necessarily data.frame).

title: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
text: Unlike minio_get_* readers, function enforce tabular structure. returned object exactly jsonlite::fromJSON() produces, typically list, vector, nested structure depending JSON content parsing options. Additional arguments forwarded jsonlite::fromJSON(), allowing control simplification, flattening, unboxing, handling nested data.

title: Read a JSON File from MinIO — minio_get_json
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ json <- minio_get_json(   bucket = "assets",   object = "config/settings.json",   simplifyVector = FALSE )  json$database$host } # }

what: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
title: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
text: Retrieves metadata (HTTP headers) object stored MinIO bucket using HEAD request. querying metadata, function verifies object exists using minio_object_exists. object exist, error raised.

title: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
code: minio_get_metadata(bucket, object, quiet = TRUE, use_https = TRUE, region = "")

title: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. quiet Logical. TRUE (default), suppresses informational messages emitted underlying client HEAD request. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
text: named list containing object metadata following elements: exists: Always TRUE function returns. bucket: Bucket name. object: Object key. size: Object size bytes. last_modified: Last modification date (character). etag: Object ETag. content_type: Content type. headers: Full list headers returned MinIO.

title: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
text: returned information typically includes object size, last modification date, ETag, content type, headers provided MinIO.

title: Retrieve Object Metadata from MinIO — minio_get_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ info <- minio_get_metadata("assets", "path/file.parquet") info$size info$last_modified } # }

what: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
title: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
text: Downloads object MinIO bucket returns contents raw vector. downloading, function checks whether object exists using minio_object_exists. object exist, error raised.

title: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
code: minio_get_object(bucket, object, use_https = TRUE, region = "")

title: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
text: raw vector object contents.

title: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
text: function intended low-level building block higher-level helpers (e.g., reading CSV/Parquet), centralizing validation download logic.

title: Download an Object from MinIO as Raw Bytes — minio_get_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ x <- minio_get_object(   bucket = "assets",   object = "path/file.parquet" ) length(x) } # }

what: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
title: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
text: Downloads Parquet .parquet file stored MinIO bucket reads memory using arrow package. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, writes temporary file, delegates parsing read_parquet.

title: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
code: minio_get_parquet(bucket, object)

title: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) Parquet file within bucket.

title: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
text: tabular object read Parquet file. exact return type   depends Arrow configuration may data.frame,   tibble, arrow::Table.

title: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
text: returned object depends Arrow backend configuration may base data.frame, tibble, arrow::Table. Unlike minio_get_* readers, function coerce result specific R data structure, allowing users take full advantage Arrow large lazy workflows.

title: Read a Parquet File from MinIO — minio_get_parquet
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tbl <- minio_get_parquet(   bucket = "vault",   object = "data/example.parquet" )  # Convert explicitly if needed df <- as.data.frame(tbl) } # }

what: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
title: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
text: Downloads R workspace file (.RData .rda) stored MinIO bucket loads contents isolated environment. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, writes temporary file, delegates deserialization load.

title: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
code: minio_get_rdata(bucket, object)

title: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) .RData .rda file within bucket.

title: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
text: named list containing objects loaded file.

title: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
text: avoid polluting caller's environment, objects loaded new, empty environment returned named list. list element corresponds one object stored .RData/.rda file. Unlike minio_get_rds(), returns single R object, function always returns collection objects, making suitable archived workspaces multi-object snapshots.

title: Read an RData/RDA File from MinIO — minio_get_rdata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ objs <- minio_get_rdata(   bucket = "assets",   object = "snapshots/data.RData" )  names(objs) df <- objs$df } # }

what: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
title: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
text: Downloads R serialized .rds file stored MinIO bucket deserializes memory. Internally, function retrieves object contents raw bytes using minio_get_object, writes temporary file, delegates deserialization readRDS.

title: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
code: minio_get_rds(bucket, object)

title: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) .rds file within bucket.

title: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
text: R object deserialized .rds file.

title: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
text: Unlike tabular readers minio_get_csv() minio_get_parquet(), function enforce specific data structure. returned value exactly R object serialized .rds file created (example, data frame, list, model object, R object).

title: Read an RDS File from MinIO — minio_get_rds
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ model <- minio_get_rds(   bucket = "assets",   object = "models/linear_model.rds" )  summary(model) } # }

what: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
title: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
text: Lists object keys stored MinIO bucket, optionally filtered prefix (example, simulating folder structure).

title: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
code: minio_list_objects(bucket, prefix = NULL, use_https = TRUE, region = "")

title: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. prefix Character NULL. Optional prefix used filter object keys. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3

title: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
text: character vector containing object keys. objects   found, returns character(0).

title: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
text: function thin wrapper around aws.s3::get_bucket(), providing simplified safer interface MinIO environments.

title: List Objects in a MinIO Bucket — minio_list_objects
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ minio_list_objects("my-bucket") minio_list_objects("my-bucket", prefix = "data/raw/") } # }

what: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
title: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
text: Moves object source bucket/key destination bucket/key performing copy operation followed delete source object.

title: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
code: minio_move_object(   from_bucket,   from_object,   to_bucket,   to_object = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE,   verify = TRUE,   verify_size = TRUE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
text: from_bucket Character. Source bucket name. from_object Character. Source object key (path). to_bucket Character. Destination bucket name. to_object Character NULL. Destination object key (path). NULL empty, defaults from_object. overwrite Logical. TRUE, overwrites destination object already exists. Defaults FALSE. verify Logical. TRUE, checks destination object exists copy deleting source. Defaults TRUE. verify_size Logical. TRUE, compares object size (bytes) source destination deleting source. Defaults TRUE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
text: Invisibly returns TRUE move successful.

title: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
text: deleting source object, function can verify destination exists object size (content-length) matches source destination.

title: Move an Object in MinIO (Copy + Remove with Size Verification) — minio_move_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ minio_move_object(   from_bucket = "raw",   from_object = "data/file.parquet",   to_bucket   = "curated",   overwrite   = FALSE ) } # }

what: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
title: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
text: Checks whether object exists MinIO bucket using HEAD request. function returns TRUE object exists FALSE object exist.

title: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
code: minio_object_exists(   bucket,   object,   quiet = TRUE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
text: bucket Character scalar. Name MinIO bucket. object Character scalar. Object key (path) within bucket. quiet Logical. TRUE (default), suppresses informational messages emitted underlying aws.s3 client. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3. MinIO deployments, can usually set value (example, "us-east-1").

title: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
text: Logical scalar. TRUE object exists. FALSE object exist.

title: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
text: MinIO S3-compatible services, non-existing object typically results response containing attribute x-minio-error-code = "NoSuchKey", interpreted "object exist". unexpected response error (example, permission issues, missing bucket, network problems) results error. function intended single, low-level existence-check primitive used internally operations read, copy, delete.

title: Check Whether an Object Exists in MinIO — minio_object_exists
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ minio_object_exists(   bucket = "assets",   object = "data/file.parquet" )  if (minio_object_exists("assets", "data/file.parquet")) {   message("Object exists") } } # }

what: Upload an Object to MinIO from Memory — minio_put_object
title: Upload an Object to MinIO from Memory — minio_put_object
text: Uploads object MinIO bucket using -memory raw vector. maximum cross-platform compatibility, payload first written temporary file uploaded using put_object.

title: Upload an Object to MinIO from Memory — minio_put_object
code: minio_put_object(   bucket,   object,   raw,   content_type = NULL,   multipart = FALSE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Upload an Object to MinIO from Memory — minio_put_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. raw Raw vector containing object payload. content_type Character NULL. Optional MIME type (e.g., "text/csv", "application/octet-stream"). multipart Logical. Whether use multipart upload. Defaults FALSE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Upload an Object to MinIO from Memory — minio_put_object
text: Invisibly returns TRUE upload successful.

title: Upload an Object to MinIO from Memory — minio_put_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ payload <- charToRaw("hello\n") minio_put_object("vault", payload, "tests/hello.txt", content_type = "text/plain") } # }

what: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
title: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
text: Reads multiple Parquet objects MinIO concatenates . Objects can provided explicitly via objects discovered via prefix optional regex pattern. Optionally filters objects date-like suffix key: _YYYY, _YYYYMM, _YYYYMMDD (inclusive range).

title: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
code: minio_read_many(   bucket,   objects = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   pattern = NULL,   date_from = NULL,   date_to = NULL,   warn_bytes = 1e+09,   out_dir = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. objects Character vector NULL. Explicit object keys read. prefix Character NULL. Prefix listing objects objects NULL. pattern Character NULL. Regex pattern filter keys using prefix. date_from, date_to Character/numeric NULL. Inclusive range filter based suffix. 4 digits -> year, 6 digits -> yearmonth, 8 digits -> yearmonthday. Example: date_from = 2020, date_to = 2024 filters _YYYY. warn_bytes Numeric. total remote size exceeds threshold, warning emitted. Defaults 1e9 (≈ 1 GB). out_dir Character NULL. provided, results streamed local directory Parquet dataset (one file per input object) function returns directory path. verbose Logical. Whether print progress messages. Defaults TRUE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
text: out_dir NULL, returns data.frame (union schema).   out_dir provided, returns out_dir (invisibly) writing dataset.

title: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
text: function computes total remote bytes using minio_get_metadata warns estimated size exceeds warn_bytes. large reads, can stream results local Parquet dataset directory via out_dir. Concatenation schema-union: output includes columns across files. Missing columns individual files filled NA.

title: Read and Concatenate Many Parquet Objects from MinIO — minio_read_many
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Explicit keys df <- minio_read_many(   bucket = "assets",   objects = c("raw/x_202301.parquet", "raw/x_202302.parquet") )  # Prefix + pattern + date range by year df <- minio_read_many(   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "raw/x/",   pattern = "\\\\.parquet$",   date_from = 2020,   date_to = 2024 )  # Stream to local dataset (recommended for large volumes) out <- minio_read_many(   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "raw/x/",   pattern = "\\\\.parquet$",   date_from = 202301,   date_to = 202312,   out_dir = "output/many_parquet_dataset" ) } # }

what: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
title: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
text: Reads object stored MinIO bucket automatically detecting file type object key extension delegating corresponding minio_get_* function (e.g., CSV, Parquet, JSON, XLSX, etc.).

title: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
code: minio_read_object(bucket, object, ...)

title: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. file extension used infer type (e.g., .csv, .parquet). ... Additional arguments passed underlying reader function selected file type (e.g., sep CSV, sheet XLSX, flatten JSON, etc.).

title: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
text: parsed object. tabular formats, returns data.frame.   JSON, returns parsed JSON object (typically list). RDS,   returns stored R object. RData/RDA, returns named list.

title: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
text: function designed convenience wrapper users need learn single reader function.

title: Read an Object from MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_read_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # CSV df <- minio_read_object("assets", "raw/data.csv", sep = ";")  # Excel df2 <- minio_read_object("assets", "raw/report.xlsx", sheet = 2)  # JSON x <- minio_read_object("assets", "raw/config.json", flatten = TRUE)  # RDS model <- minio_read_object("assets", "models/model.rds")  # RData / RDA objs <- minio_read_object("assets", "snapshots/objects.RData") } # }

what: Remove an Object from MinIO — minio_remove_object
title: Remove an Object from MinIO — minio_remove_object
text: Removes (deletes) object MinIO bucket. deletion, function checks whether object exists using minio_object_exists. object exist, error raised.

title: Remove an Object from MinIO — minio_remove_object
code: minio_remove_object(bucket, object, use_https = TRUE, region = "")

title: Remove an Object from MinIO — minio_remove_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Remove an Object from MinIO — minio_remove_object
text: Invisibly returns TRUE object successfully removed.

title: Remove an Object from MinIO — minio_remove_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ minio_remove_object(   bucket = "assets",   object = "path/file.parquet" ) } # }

what: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
title: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
text: Removes (deletes) multiple objects MinIO bucket. can either: Provide explicit vector object keys via objects, Select objects listing prefix filtering regex pattern.

title: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
code: minio_remove_objects(   bucket,   objects = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   pattern = NULL,   dry_run = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE,   error_on_missing = TRUE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. objects Character vector NULL. Explicit object keys remove. prefix Character NULL. Prefix used list candidate objects objects NULL. pattern Character NULL. Regex pattern applied object keys (prefix listing). NULL, objects prefix selected. dry_run Logical. TRUE, delete anything; returns deletion plan. Defaults FALSE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses progress messages. Defaults TRUE. error_on_missing Logical. TRUE (default), missing objects cause error (consistent minio_remove_object). FALSE, missing objects recorded skipped. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
text: data.frame columns: object, removed, error.   dry_run = TRUE, removed always FALSE error NA.

title: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
text: Deletions performed calling minio_remove_object object.

title: Remove Multiple Objects from MinIO — minio_remove_objects
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Remove explicit objects res <- minio_remove_objects(   bucket = "assets",   objects = c("tmp/a.csv", "tmp/b.csv") )  # Remove by prefix + regex pattern res <- minio_remove_objects(   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "tmp/",   pattern = "\\\\.csv$" )  # Dry-run plan <- minio_remove_objects(   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "tmp/",   dry_run = TRUE ) } # }

what: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
title: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
text: Convenience wrapper aws.s3::s3sync() tailored MinIO usage. synchronizes local directory bucket/prefix, uploading /downloading missing files.

title: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
code: minio_sync_objects(   path = ".",   bucket,   prefix = "",   sync = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "",   ... )

title: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
text: path Character. Local directory path synchronize. Defaults ".". bucket Character. Name bucket. prefix Character. Prefix (remote "subdirectory") consider. Defaults "". subdirectory-like behavior, typically include trailing slash (e.g. "raw/projectA/"). sync Character NULL. One "server" (upload), "local" (download), NULL two-way sync (upload + download). verbose Logical. Whether verbose. Defaults TRUE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. Defaults TRUE. region Character. Region string required aws.s3. Defaults "". ... Additional arguments passed aws.s3::s3sync() (s3HTTP), multipart, headers, etc.

title: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
text: Logical. Returns TRUE sync completed successfully.

title: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
text: Compared aws.s3::s3sync(), wrapper: Uses sync instead direction:     "server" means upload, "local" means download, omitted     performs two-way sync (upload + download), matching s3sync() default. Forces create = FALSE. Defaults use_https = TRUE region = "".

title: Sync Local Files/Directories with MinIO (Wrapper around aws.s3::s3sync) — minio_sync_objects
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Two-way (upload + download), default behavior minio_sync_objects(   path = "data/projectA",   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "raw/projectA/" )  # Only upload local -> server minio_sync_objects(   path = "data/projectA",   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "raw/projectA/",   sync = "server" )  # Only download server -> local minio_sync_objects(   path = "data/projectA",   bucket = "assets",   prefix = "raw/projectA/",   sync = "local" ) } # }

what: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
title: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
text: Serializes R object bytes (raw) based file extension object uploads MinIO using minio_put_object.

title: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
code: minio_write_object(   bucket,   object,   x,   ...,   content_type = NULL,   multipart = FALSE,   use_https = TRUE,   region = "" )

title: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
text: bucket Character. Name MinIO bucket. object Character. Object key (path) within bucket. Extension used infer serialization format. x R object serialize upload (often data.frame, list, model, etc.). ... Additional arguments passed underlying writer function. content_type Character NULL. Optional MIME type. NULL, sensible default used based extension. multipart Logical. Whether use multipart upload. Defaults FALSE. use_https Logical. Whether use HTTPS connecting MinIO. region Character. Region string required aws.s3.

title: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
text: Invisibly returns TRUE upload successful.

title: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
text: Supported formats selected extension: .csv via utils::write.csv() .parquet / .pq via arrow::write_parquet() .json via jsonlite::toJSON() .xlsx via writexl::write_xlsx() .feather via feather::write_feather() .dta via haven::write_dta() .rds via saveRDS() .rda / .RData via save() Additional arguments (...) forwarded underlying writer selected extension.

title: Write an Object to MinIO (Auto-detect by Extension) — minio_write_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # CSV minio_write_object("assets", "tmp/df.csv", mtcars, row.names = FALSE)  # JSON (returns JSON in MinIO) minio_write_object("assets", "tmp/config.json", list(a = 1, b = TRUE), auto_unbox = TRUE)  # RDS minio_write_object("assets", "tmp/model.rds", lm(mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars))  # RData (stores an object named 'x' by default) minio_write_object("assets", "tmp/objects.RData", mtcars) } # }

title: minioR 0.1.0
text: Initial public release. version provides stable, production-oriented interface interacting MinIO object storage R, focus explicit APIs, robust error handling, data engineering workflows.

title: minioR 0.1.0
text: Added core object management helpers: minio_list_objects() minio_object_exists() minio_get_metadata() Added generic read helpers: minio_get_object() minio_download_object() minio_read_object() minio_read_many() Added format-specific readers: minio_get_csv() minio_get_parquet() minio_get_json() minio_get_xlsx() minio_get_dta() minio_get_feather() minio_get_rds() minio_get_rdata() Added write upload helpers: minio_put_object() minio_fput_object() minio_fput_dir() minio_write_object() Added server-side object operations: minio_copy_object() minio_move_object() minio_sync_objects() Added delete helpers: minio_remove_object() minio_remove_objects()

title: minioR 0.1.0
text: public functions fail fast explicit informative error messages. Safe defaults enforced automated scheduled pipelines. silent side effects user environment. Minimal abstraction S3-compatible APIs, optimized MinIO workflows.

title: minioR 0.1.0
text: Comprehensive unit integration test coverage. Optional dependencies (arrow, haven, readxl) handled gracefully. CI configured multiple R versions operating systems.
